summary: This is an email chain from August 11, 2019, where a journalist from the UK's Daily Telegraph, Nick Allen, inquires about the Epstein investigation, specifically asking whether authorities want to question Prince Andrew and if Ghislaine Maxwell is cooperating. The email is forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Nick Allen
persons.context: Washington Editor for The Daily Telegraph who sent an inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office about the Epstein investigation, specifically regarding Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Subject of the journalist's inquiry, asking if U.S. authorities want to question him in connection with the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the journalist's inquiry, asking if she is cooperating with authorities, as reported by the New York Post.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same journalistic inquiry regarding the Epstein investigation, implying a perceived connection in the public/media eye.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry to US Attorney's Office
events.description: Nick Allen of The Daily Telegraph emails the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to inquire about the status of the Epstein investigation, specifically regarding Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: London (location of Telegraph Media Group Limited)
New York (implied location of U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: On August 11, 2019, a journalist from the UK's Daily Telegraph directly contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office with questions about the Epstein investigation.
The inquiry specifically asked if U.S. authorities wanted to question Prince Andrew, a British royal.
The inquiry also referenced a New York Post report claiming Ghislaine Maxwell was 'cooperating with authorities' and sought confirmation.
The email was forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office with a brief note 'I'll handle. Thanks.', indicating internal coordination on the media inquiry.
